column4: I like what Ubuntu is *trying* to do. Just not the way they are going about it.
But I use it because regardless of Unity, I set everything how I like it.
I have the codecs and VLC no problem.
I think that they have a LOT of compatibility issues to work out.
Yea they come with the Restricteds that you can mark for installation on setup.
-Running Ubuntu Studio on a VM, but in Ubuntu right now. Doing a review of studio later tonight.
Primary, I am going to link you to a help page, with the commands you need.
I'll see, is that a repository?
I still cannot play wma through vlc, moc, or mplayer
parole media player(gstreamer(?) came with xubuntu) complains about plugins needed
Package w64codecs is not available, but is referred to by another package. This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or is only available from another source.
what howto are you looking at

so I did all that, installed the w64codecs, enabled medibuntu and installed its mplayer + avcodec, and I still get "Requested audio codec family [wma9dmo] (afm=dmo) not available.". Enable it at compilation. Should I just grab the source and compile it? Jesus christ.
I did not encode these, and if I want to even make use of these I need to transcode them into another format. I prefer Xiph's Vorbis.
You do not have to be sorry, I'll just compile.
